bibl.title: Letter from Paul North Rice to Philip Showalter Hench, September 4, 1940

div1.p: Rice lists the Havana newspapers that are available in his library and the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Paul North Rice to Philip Showalter Hench, September 4, 1940

opener.dateline:
The New York Public Library
Astor, Xenox and Tilden Foundations
New York, September 4, 1940 REFERENCE DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE CHIEF
FIFTH AVENUE & 42ND STREET
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota

div1.p: In reply to your letter of August 26th:

Among our holdings in the Newspaper Division we have
only the following Havana newspaper for 1900:
Gaceta de la Habana, Jan. 2 - Mar. 31, May 1 -
Dec. 30.

We believe the Library of Congress at Washington,
D. C. has the following for the same year:
Diario de la Marina, 1900.
La Discusion, Apr. - July, 1900.
Havana Post, May 1 - Dec. 1900.
La Union espanola, 1900.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Paul North Rice
Chief of the Reference Department 84/EEP
BE
